keyword: how many calories are in bottle of wine
title: How Many Calories Are in a Bottle of Wine?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in bottle of wine—about 625 for a standard 750 ml dry table wine—plus full nutrition breakdown, equivalents, and variations by type.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Bottle of Wine?
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle of dry table wine (red or white), 12% ABV, minimal residual sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness level, alcohol content, brand, and serving size. Check bottle labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry wine contains about 625 calories, primarily from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Opt for a lower-alcohol wine (9% ABV)
Choose a sweeter wine (e.g., off-dry with higher sugars)
Select a sparkling wine (slightly drier, lower density)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a glass of wine from a bottle?
faqs.a: A standard 150 ml glass from a dry wine bottle has about 125 calories.

faqs.q: Do red and white wines have different calories per bottle?
faqs.a: Similar—both around 625 kcal for dry 750 ml bottles; whites may be slightly lower by 20-50 kcal.

faqs.q: How does wine sweetness affect calories in a bottle?
faqs.a: Dry wines: ~625 kcal; sweeter varieties like Riesling can add 100-300 kcal from sugars.

faqs.q: What about calories in a bottle of rosé wine?
faqs.a: Comparable to dry red or white, around 600-650 kcal for a 750 ml bottle.

faqs.q: Does the bottle size change the total calories?
faqs.a: Yes—a 375 ml half-bottle has about 312 kcal, while a 1.5 L magnum doubles to ~1,250 kcal.
